sub_topic: The Mandelbrot set and its fractal properties
message_1: What is the area of the largest cardioid in the Mandelbrot set, in square units?
message_2:
The largest cardioid in the Mandelbrot set is the main cardioid, which is the region connected to the origin. The area of the main cardioid can be found using the formula:

Area = (π/4) * (2 - √2)^2

Area ≈ 1.2732395447351628 square units
